text: hi everyone its Adam here today I will
be making a dish from the countryside of
southern Vietnam called Mong Kok where
MPO days meat is something that poor
people couldn't afford so the whole
family meal might just include a small
bowl of this stupid sauce and some
vegetables that they have in the
backyard or maybe just some buns rice
come guy it's a very easy simple and
inexpensive dish but could bring back
tons of memories for people who have
lived through the poverty and
difficulties of Vietnam nowadays the
dish has become very popular even in the
cities and it's also listed in many
luxurious restaurant menus as a very
stylish specialty so today let's learn
how to make it
for this recipe you will need about 2
tbsp of pop fat diced about 1 ounce or
30 grams of lean pork sliced about 3
tablespoons of dried shrooms which is
soaked in hot water to soften a small
clay pot or you can also use a small
saucepan or a pen one thing lease light
shallot some red chilies and 3 small
cloves of garlic for the vegetables
today I have daikon radish which is cut
in two by side sticks some okra or
ladies fingers do bub cauliflower and
broccoli which are separated into small
florets some carrots also cut into
sticks a bitter melon and zucchini in
Vietnam we normally eat with opals wash
or die Bowl but it's not popular with a
leaf so I'm using such you need to
substitute because it has quite similar
texture and taste you can either cut it
into sticks or into circles like this in
a small bowl combine a teaspoon of pork
stock which is optional 3 tbsp of sugar
and 3 tablespoons of fish sauce of
course you can adjust the ratio a little
to your taste then stir well to dissolve
heat the clay pot on medium-high and add
the dice pop fat if your fry of fat and
cholesterol you can use vegetable oil
too I just want to show you how it is
originally made stir occasionally to
render the fat if you don't have a clay
pot you can use a small saucepan just
choose the one with thick bottom so that
it won't burn too fast after a few
minutes the fat is rendered and the
cubes turn quite golden brown just
remove the pot rice or Topmodel it can
be used add toppings give the fat in the
clay pot then add the sliced shallots
and smash garlic and saute until
fragrant
grind the shrimps and add to the cry
pots together with the slide POC keep
the dry shrooms and pork very minimum
because this is not a caramelized pork
and shrimp dish the star should be the
Vsauce we just want to have some chunks
in the dips so it won't be too boring in
fact in the old days they might just
have fish sauce or maybe with some small
anchovies or shrimp sketch in the fresh
water when the pork is no longer pink
you can add in the fish sauce is the
fish sauce study the star of the dish so
use good quality fish sauce if you can
as the chilies and some freshly cracked
pepper then keep simmering our medium
heat for about 20 to 30 minutes the
shrimps and the pot on a shrink a lot
just keep simmering until the fish sauce
is calaman right and thickens meanwhile
we can prepare the vegetables bring a
saucepan of water to a boil and add some
salt quickly blanch the vegetables for
just a minute to maintain the
crunchiness you can cook a little longer
if you want this softer actually you can
use any kind of vegetables that you like
asparagus celery celery AK cora bees
parsnips green beans etc you don't need
to have everything just one or two types
is good enough some vegetables like
beets a melon or okra might takes a
little longer to cook about 3 to 5
minutes the rest can be blanched very
quickly when the sauce bubbles and
thickens like this is ready to serve
arrange the vegetable nicely around the
plate and place the clay pot in the
middle the clay pot is used because it
can maintain the heat well you can keep
the dip warm during the meal add more
peppers and top with the pot rides
tomorrow
traditionally is soft with hot steamed
rice or some buns rice come guy but
nowadays it can also be served at
drinking snack it could be an
interesting vegetable dip idea for
parties if your friends on my eating fee
sauce you can also skip the rice to have
it at no diet food the sauce is sweet
and salty so just don't eat too much if
you're not eating with rice is super
super yummy that's it I hope you like it
don't forget to click like and subscribe
thank you for watching bye bye
